ygData.subject: is Tomcat RESTful?
ygData.msgSnippet: Don t know why I didn t think of this before. Tomcat uses a URL based API for managing web applications. It s documented here:

Don't know why I didn't think of this before. 

Tomcat uses a URL based AP=
I for managing web applications. It's
documented here:
<http://jakarta.apac=
he.org/tomcat/tomcat-4.0-doc/manager-howto.html>. 

You send it URLs, it re=
turns text/plain responses (essentially, 'ok' and
'fail'). Also it's maybe =
a live example of a resource with nested
resources (the Tomcat model is an =
uber application which manages nested
applications, which manage nested ser=
vlets/jsps/images... you get the
idea). 

The thing is, it uses GET to alte=
r|deploy|start|stop applications in its
container; ie it has GETs with side=
 effects. Which doesn't seem very
RESTful.

Thoughts?

regards,
Bill de h=
=D3ra
